body:
It is indeed possible to run an app without ActiveRecord, and the configurations support it. However, if you generate an app without using a --skip flag, it will generate a development.rb that calls active_record configs that do not exist. That's another bug.

It's also possible to remove ActionMailer, but there's no support for it in --skip flags that I could see and it suffers from the same development.rb problem as ActiveRecord.

The fact that Rails really can be stripped to the gills is a really compelling and little-known capability. It should be a first-class feature and promoted more heavily, imho, especially given how many apps use alternative data stores, etc.
